utterance.speaker: ZEKE
utterance.content: Testing, testing … 1… 2… 3.

utterance.speaker: ZEKE
utterance.content: Damn it!

utterance.speaker: HANK RODGERS
utterance.content: Sorry, man.

utterance.speaker: KEITH BLUE
utterance.content: Yo, here it is! The reviews from last night’s show!

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: Do we want to hear it?

utterance.speaker: KEITH
utterance.content: Only if you want to be called the next Nirvana.

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: Yeah, right.

utterance.speaker: ZEKE
utterance.content: Dude, he’s not kidding. “Holy Shemp’s future is now. They’re about to explode, just like one of singer Keith Blue’s signature screams.

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: Yeah! We’re taking off baby!

utterance.speaker: KEITH
utterance.content: Where’s James? They’re comparing him to The Edge.

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: He’s probably still asleep.

utterance.speaker: KEITH
utterance.content: Let’s go wake his ass up!

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: Is this real?

utterance.speaker: KEITH
utterance.content: Jimmy! Wake-y, wake-y Jim Bob. I’m coming in with a camera! C’mon. I seriously hope his junk is not flapping in the breeze like last time. C’mon.

utterance.speaker: KEITH
utterance.content: Help! Help! Help me! Help me!

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, get rid of the cameras.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ll … take care of it. Hey! Officer! We need to lose these cameras, you know that. No press allowed.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER
utterance.content: They’re not press. They’re shooting some kind of movie.

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: No, they’re filming a documentary about the band.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And you are?

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: I’m Hank Rodgers. I’m … one of the roadies.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You knew the victim. All right, well, I’m going to need a statement, ‘kay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re kidding me. They’re in here, too.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: I asked them to leave, but he said that the director told them to shoot all this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How’d you like to try to film with a cracked lens, huh? Huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, Espo. Just go get their director. Tell him to get their crew out of here.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey Esposito.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone didn’t get their … coffee.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s this?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: They are making a documentary on the band.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, just ignore them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Richard Castle, novelist. My latest, Frozen Heat, in stores now. Have you met, uh, Nikki Heat’s inspiration – – Detective Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, what else do we know?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: The victim is James Swan, he’s the lead guitarist of Holy Shemp. They must be Three Stooges fans. Based on lividity I’d say the time of death is between 12 and 2AM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look at that. “Observe”. An unheeded call to vigilance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So that’s the murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmhmm. Looks like a Gibson Les Paul. ‘59 Flame Top if I’m not mistaken – and I’m rarely mistaken. Oh … it’s hot.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Tell me about this guitar?

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: The ’59 Flame Top. It’s his favorite. Last night after the show I tuned it and I dropped it off at his trailer. He likes to compose on it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. Well, what time was that at?

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: Around 11:30.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. Was he alone at the time?

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. We chatted for a second. He was always really nice to me. It was all about the music with him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Was there uh … anyone hanging outside the trailer? Maybe someone you didn’t recognize?

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: I saw a white van. It went around the block a couple of times.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did you get a plate number?

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: I’m sorry. It was dark.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. Um … don’t go anywhere.

utterance.speaker: JOEL MITAS
utterance.content: Yeah, no. You can’t pull your funding. Just –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo! You the director?

utterance.speaker: JOEL
utterance.content: Yeah, no. You – look, we are sitting on gold, here. Okay? This – this is part rock-doc, part –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is a crime scene. You gotta get these cameras out of here.

utterance.speaker: JOEL
utterance.content: All right, look. I gotta go. Just … call me if you can get that thing. Look, you gotta help me out here. Okay? I – I’ve been following these guys nonstop for three months.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not anymore. Police procedure. Sorry. And if you’ve been following the victim 24/7 I’m going to need to see that footage.

utterance.speaker: JOEL
utterance.content: No! Detective! Look, I – I’m in a spot here, okay? James Swan was that band. With him gone, no one is going to care about these guys. Or want to see this film. So unless I can reinvent it as some sort of thriller, you know, a hunt for the murderer? People love that stuff.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Listen to me. A guy’s dead here. So if you don’t get rid of these cameras I’m going to break one over –

utterance.speaker: JOEL
utterance.content: Sorry. Yeah, go ahead.

utterance.speaker: JOEL
utterance.content: Oh, great! Okay, hang on. I’m going to give you to the Detective. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This was a crime of passion. There was an argument, things got heated, the killer grabbed the nearest heavy object and felled poor Mr. Swan at a tragically young age of –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - how old was he?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. Another one for the club.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What club?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The 27 Club. Memberships include some of the greats. Jimi Hendrix, Jim Morrison, Janis Joplin. The list is extensive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, we kind of need a different list. Like who might have been in this trailer last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I know where to start.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie. Go! Get out of here!

utterance.speaker: BUTTERFLY
utterance.content: Oh my God, thank you.

utterance.speaker: BUTTERFLY
utterance.content: The guy was a total genius. I followed the band for 6 months trying to meet him. A couple of weeks ago James and I got together. And every night since I’d meet him in his trailer right after the show.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you were in his trailer when it happened.

utterance.speaker: BUTTERFLY
utterance.content: I guess. I mean, I um – I – I don’t remember anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, how can you not remember?

utterance.speaker: BUTTERFLY
utterance.content: I passed out. I guess I partied a little too hard during the show. I’m sorry, I want to help.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Listen, Miss –

utterance.speaker: BUTTERFLY
utterance.content: Butterfly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - Butterfly, this is very important. Do you remember anything about that night? Anything at all?

utterance.speaker: BUTTERFLY
utterance.content: In his trailer, I heard a horse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … a horse as in … whinnying?

utterance.speaker: BUTTERFLY
utterance.content: No, I heard the sound of horse hooves crunching in the snow. Like crunch, crunch, crunch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, can we just focus on what happened … just before you passed out. Did he seem like he was upset? Did he seem like he had been fighting with anyone?

utterance.speaker: BUTTERFLY
utterance.content: Actually the opposite. He’d been complaining a lot about the other guys in the band recently, you know? The arguments and the tension. Last night he seemed happy. You know? Like he’d found some kind of peace.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know if that girl could swing a guitar with enough force to kill anyone but I still gotta check her clothes for blood spatter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m more interested in what the band members were fighting about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey! What are you guys doing here? Get out of here now. This is a police investigation. You have no right to be here.

utterance.speaker: JOEL
utterance.content: Ah, actually … that’s not true.

utterance.speaker: VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: I’m sorry Detective, but it’s out of my hands. City Hall has decided it’s good PR.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, what about the case? They’re going to compromise the investigation.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I feel the same way as you do. But a decision has been made and I expect you to comply to it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine, then just have them stay out of my way.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Hi, uh … welcome. I’m Captain Gates, head of the 12th Precinct. In cooperation with the NYPD’s public affairs division I am happy to grant you with fill access to the department. I think you will find everyone here more than … accommodating.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Welcome.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Welcome.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon, what’s the big deal? It’ll be fun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? Castle, what I do here, this is mine. And just because they want to invade my privacy that doesn’t mean that I have to help them do it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, well, that may be, but these cameras, they’re not going anywhere. They’re going to see something. I just want them to see what I see.

utterance.speaker: KEITH
utterance.content: Hold on, why do you need our alibis?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because we understand there was some tension between Mr. Swan and the band.

utterance.speaker: KEITH
utterance.content: Of course there was tension. You spend every second together it’s not going to be pretty.

utterance.speaker: ZEKE
utterance.content: We’d been together 5 years. If you had any idea the kind of crap you go through trying to make it in this business. It has a way of bonding people.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or making them really, really sick of each other.

utterance.speaker: KEITH
utterance.content: Hey, we looked out for James. He was a middle class kid from Ohio. He didn’t know what the hell he was getting into with this life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well we’re still going to need statements about where you were last night.

utterance.speaker: KEITH
utterance.content: Fine. I was in my trailer. I went there right after the show.

utterance.speaker: ZEKE
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: We were all in our trailers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Well, we have reports that there was a white van in the area. Did James even mention anything about that?

utterance.speaker: ZEKE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: But he did think someone was following him.

utterance.speaker: KEITH
utterance.content: Uh, it was a month ago. Right around the time we played Ithaca. He was acting all paranoid. He was talking about hiring extra security.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he say who he was afraid of?

utterance.speaker: KEITH
utterance.content: No, but he hadn’t brought it up recently so I just assumed everything was normal. Until he pulled that stunt yesterday.

utterance.speaker: ZEKE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened yesterday?

utterance.speaker: ZEKE
utterance.content: He blew off our 1 o’clock band meeting. We didn’t see him again until sound check at 6.

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: The guy never missed a band meeting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he say where he was going?

utterance.speaker: KEITH
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ZEKE
utterance.content: But I do know this. Camera guy that was following him said that James ditched him on purpose.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So whatever he was doing he didn’t want anyone to know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. You guys got a sec?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So, uh … I’ve been going through the documentary footage of our vic. Check this out.

utterance.speaker: JAMES
utterance.content: Most guys will tell you that they learned to play guitar themselves, but … I had a mentor. And the guy was incredible. Much better than I’ll ever be.

utterance.speaker: INTERVIEWER
utterance.content: What’s he think of the band?

utterance.speaker: JAMES
utterance.content: You know, we lost touch a ways back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There. You see that guy? That was taken over a month ago. These are more recent. All right. Just … … there we go. Boom. the guy in a photo) Boom. Boom.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, looks like our vic had a stalker.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Check out this one. This one’s from yesterday. Look what he’s leaning against.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A white van.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ve got you now, you son of a b*itch.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m sorry, can I even say son of a –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So we blew up the picture of the white van wide enough to get a license plate. It’s registered to an address somewhere around here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Make a right up ahead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, I’m going another way.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do you mean? There’s only one way.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, there’s a different way. There’s a back way.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There’s no back way.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Trust me. Trust me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I know how this must look, but we actually make a pretty good team because we each have different strengths.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s true. For example, I’m former military which makes me an expert marksman. I’m usually first through the door.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well yeah, but somebody’s gotta know which door to go through. I’m a little bit more, um … circumspect than my partner here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m kinda like the nerve center of the team.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m definitely the physical one. I stay in sick shape. Boom! Been to the gun show? Just kidding. I’m just – seriously though, I’m in sick shape.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dude. What’s with your shirt? It’s really tight. Did you change it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I spilled something … on it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah … there it is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Slow approach.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Stay close.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I think he saw us.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I got this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let’s go check out the van.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What do we have here? Uh oh. Pretty sure that ain’t ketchup.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, is that our stalker?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ex-stalker. He won’t be seeing daylight any time soon.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey LT, could you please take him to the interrogation room? Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You should watch form observation while I tear this guy apart.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So uh … we like this guy?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We found blood stained overalls in his van. We sent them to be tested, see if they match the blood form our vic.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, they match. Trust me, bro. You won’t have to worry about this creep hurting anyone ever again. That’s a gift from me to you. You’re welcome, America.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I miss anything?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, they’re just getting started.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Gasoline? You wanted to do nasty things to James Swan.

utterance.speaker: JOE SILVA
utterance.content: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, I think you do. I’m going to give you a second to get your facts straight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, the time out. That’s a classic. Interrogation, it’s really an art form. I mean, Detective Beckett here, she is a master. I have watched her crack countless cases in this very room. Remember that guy who killed his gardener because he cut his roses to short?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Found your overalls. Had Swan’s blood all over them.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: It’s not his blood, it’s my blood. I cut myself when I was working on my van.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, c’mon Joe. What, do you think we’re stupid? We’ve got you on video following him for weeks. We’ve got your van at the crime scene! So why don’t you cut the innocent crap right now!

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: You want me to admit it? I admit it. I followed him. I did. I was just planning to grab him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And that’s when your plan went sideways. You tried to drag him to you van, but he didn’t want to go.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: That’s not –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And that’s when you got mad.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: That’s not what happened!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You got mad, and that’s when you busted his head open.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: I didn’t kill anybody! I just – I just – I just want my little girl.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Your little girl?

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: My daughter. She quit her job to become a groupie. Threw her life away. I was afraid she was gonna get pregnant. Or worse. All I wanted to do was grab him. I wanted to scare him a little. I wanted him to stay away from her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Your daughter.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Yes. I haven’t seen her in weeks. I don’t even know if she’s alive.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Does she go by the name of Butterfly?

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think we can help you find her. If it’s okay with my partner.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, looks like our stalker was telling the truth. Prelims show that the blood on his overalls was his. Sorry, partner.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Huh. Well, at least grabbing the guy wasn’t a total bust.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. It seems to be the definition of a total bust.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well it would have been if I hadn’t just spoken to him in holding. Seeing as how he was tailing our victim, he knew exactly where Swan was on the afternoon of his death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. Where?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He was at a bank in SoHo and then he went into a residential building on the corner of Lafayette and Broome.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but why? Swan eluded his cameraman to go on a clandestine errand. An errand so important he missed a band meeting. He was acting erratically, went to the bank right beforehand. This all points to one thing –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Drugs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - drugs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s an interesting theory, but that is pure speculation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, it’s not. Pure speculation would be Swan purchasing thermonuclear technology to have a scientist make him an amplifier that went all the way to 12. This? Musicians buying drugs? That’s just Monday morning’s crossword.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll pull a list of tenants. See if anyone pops.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie’s got something she wants us to see.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lanie? Who’s Lanie?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah … Lanie is our medical examiner and she works at the morgue and she’s got information that she wants us to see and we are keeping her waiting.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Still a little stiff.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Certainly she could tighten that up, but she’s getting better.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Victim’s blood panels came back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me guess. Drugs.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Nope. This was one clean living rock star. In fact, it’s not what he put in his body, it’s what he didn’t. James had no antibodies for polio.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He never had the polio vaccine?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wha – everyone born since the early 1960s got that vaccine.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That’s what I thought. He also had no antibodies for tetanus, measles, whooping cough – all standard immunizations.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What else?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Isn’t that enough?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, usually if you have something like this for me you just call me over the phone.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well I thought it was worth a trip.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, can you look into our vic’s medical record? I want to find out why he was never vaccinated.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, I think I figured out why James Swan went to that building. He knew a guy that lived there. A Sam Spear. Dude has an outstanding lawsuit against our vic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of lawsuit?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, he claims that James stole one of the band’s songs from him and James must have thought he had a case because when he stopped at a bank on his way to see this guy he took out $25 grand, cash.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds like he’s trying to settle out of court.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, and I’m guessing it didn’t pan out. Sam Spear bought a ticket to last night’s show.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he was at the theater right before Sam was killed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Time to pay this guy a visit.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, no, no, no. I got this. You stay here and work on your little research project, you being the nerve center and all. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, you coming?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I’m good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait up!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s not this one. Spears is in 3M.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, Detective Beckett is not an unfriendly person. She’s just got … walls. Let’s call them layers. Layers upon layers of … well, walls. But once you scale those walls, the effort is worth is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle. Keep your voice down, please.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
